intro: Paracleisthus siamensis, commonly known as the Siam spiny minnow, is a small freshwater fish native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyprinidae and is characterized by its slender body and distinctive spiny rays on its dorsal and anal fins. This species is typically found in slow-moving streams and rivers with sandy or muddy substrates. Its coloration is usually a dull silver with a faintly barred pattern. Due to habitat degradation, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
